edu.nyu.pqs.stopwatch.impl

Class Stopwatch

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.nyu.pqs.stopwatch.impl.Stopwatch
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IStopwatch

    public class Stopwatch
extends java.lang.Object
implements IStopwatch
    Description: A thread safe Stopwatch class which allows functionalities of a stop watch including start,lap stop and reset. It implements the IStopwatch class and allows users to make lap measurements and get a list of lap times.
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    pv594

      void lap()
      Method that ends a lap and adds the lap to an ArrayList containing the lap times.
      void reset()
      Method that resets the stop watch.
      void start()
      Method that starts the stop watch if its in the initial state, throws an exception if the stop watch is already running and resumes the stop watch if the stop watch was stopped.

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        public java.lang.String getId()
        Method that returns the id of the stopwatch of type String
        Specified by:
        getId in interface IStopwatch
        Returns:
        id

      • start

        public void start()
        Method that starts the stop watch if its in the initial state, throws an exception if the stop watch is already running and resumes the stop watch if the stop watch was stopped. The behavior of the start method after a stop method is that of a resume, where the stopwatch would continue the measurement of lap that was stopped.
        Specified by:
        start in interface IStopwatch
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when stop watch is already running

      • lap

        public void lap()
        Method that ends a lap and adds the lap to an ArrayList containing the lap times.
        Specified by:
        lap in interface IStopwatch
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when the stop watch is not running

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Method that stops the current lap and adds the lap to the ArrayList of lap times. The behavior of a stop is like a pause button where the lap that was stopped resumes if the stop method call is succeeded by a start method call, and the lap is added if not succeeded by a start call.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface IStopwatch
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the stop watch is not running when the stop method is called

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Method that resets the stop watch. It empties all intermediate lap calculations, deletes the laps from the ArrayList of laptimes and sets the state of the stop to its initial state.
        Specified by:
        reset in interface IStopwatch

      • getLapTimes

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Long> getLapTimes()
        Method that returns a List of lap times in milliseconds
        Specified by:
        getLapTimes in interface IStopwatch
        Returns:
        List of type Long containing the lap times.
